newsitem.title: UK: Fourth April North Sea Forties cargo cancelled.
newsitem.headline: Fourth April North Sea Forties cargo cancelled.

text.p: A fourth U.K. North Sea Forties cargo was cancelled on Tuesday because of underperformance at one of the fields contributing to Britain's largest crude stream, oil traders said.
Enterprise cancelled the 600,000 barrel cargo scheduled to load on April 25-30 as a result of lower than expected output from the North Sea Scott field.
The cargo joins cancelled loadings from April 14-16, April 17-19 and April 18-20.
The four cancellations cut the original April Forties programme by four cargoes to 40, excluding crude piped straight to the Grangemouth refinery.
